title: Lello da Orvieto
text:
Lello da Orvieto was an Italian painter and mosaicist, active in <a href="Naples">Naples</a> and <a href="Lazio">Lazio</a> between 1315 and 1340
He was born in <a href="Orvieto">Orvieto</a> and produced the 1322 or 1313 mosaic "Enthroned Madonna with Saints Januarius and Restituta" in <a href="Naples%20Cathedral">Naples Cathedral</a> - he signed it "Lellus de Urb(evetere)". Two frescoes are also attributed to him - the c.1315 "<a href="Tree%20of%20life%20%28biblical%29">Tree of Life</a>" in the cappella degli Illustrissimi in <a href="Naples%20Cathedral">Naples Cathedral</a> and the c.1320-1340 "Redeemer and Saints" in the Chapter House of the Poor Clares at <a href="Santa%20Chiara%2C%20Naples">Santa Chiara</a>.
